intro: Erigeron domingensis, commonly known as the Dominican fleabane, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean, particularly the Dominican Republic. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as dry forests and grasslands. Its flowers are usually blue to purple in color, with ray florets surrounding a central disk of tubular flowers. Erigeron domingensis is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in coastal areas.
